publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1416 Roseanna Cunningham: Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance-That the Parliament welcomes the opening, on 1 December 2000, of SAINTS - a Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance at St Andrew's in the Square, Glasgow; congratulates the organisers on their success in creating the centre, and looks forward to the important contribution this will make to Scotland's traditional acts and music. Supported by: Nicola Sturgeon*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Linda Fabiani*, Michael Russell*, Irene McGugan*
S1M-1416 Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance (lodged on 30 November 2000) Fiona McLeod*, Fergus Ewing*, Tommy Sheridan*, Donald Gorrie*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1416 Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance (lodged on 30 November 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Ms Sandra White*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-1416 Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance (lodged on 30 November 2000) Alex Neil*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1416 Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance (lodged on 30 November 2000) Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-1416 Roseanna Cunningham: Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance-That the Parliament welcomes the opening, on 1 December 2000, of SAINTS - a Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance at St Andrew's in the Square, Glasgow; congratulates the organisers on their success in creating the centre, and looks forward to the important contribution this will make to Scotland's traditional acts and music. Supported by: Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan, Fiona McLeod, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Pauline McNeill, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-1416 Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance (lodged on 30 November 2000) Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1416 Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance (lodged on 30 November 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Colin Campbell*

S1M-1416 Roseanna Cunningham: Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance-That the Parliament welcomes the opening, on 1 December 2000, of SAINTS - a Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance at St Andrew's in the Square, Glasgow; congratulates the organisers on their success in creating the centre, and looks forward to the important contribution this will make to Scotland's traditional acts and music. Supported by: Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan, Fiona McLeod, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Pauline McNeill, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Tricia Marwick, Andrew Wilson, Colin Campbell
S1M-1416 Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance (lodged on 30 November 2000) Robin Harper*
S1M-1416 Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance (lodged on 30 November 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*

S1M-1416 Roseanna Cunningham: Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance—That the Parliament welcomes the opening, on 1 December 2000, of SAINTS – a Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance at St Andrew’s in the Square, Glasgow; congratulates the organisers on their success in creating the centre, and looks forward to the important contribution this will make to Scotland’s traditional acts and music. Supported by: Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan, Fiona McLeod, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Pauline McNeill, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Tricia Marwick, Andrew Wilson, Colin Campbell, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan
S1M-1416 Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance (lodged on 30 November 2000) Dr Richard Simpson*

S1M-1416 Roseanna Cunningham: Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance—That the Parliament welcomes the opening, on 1 December 2000, of SAINTS – a Centre for Scottish Music, Song and Dance at St Andrew’s in the Square, Glasgow; congratulates the organisers on their success in creating the centre, and looks forward to the important contribution this will make to Scotland’s traditional acts and music. Supported by: Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan, Fiona McLeod, Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Pauline McNeill, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Tricia Marwick, Andrew Wilson, Colin Campbell, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dr Richard Simpson
